Hunter

One consideration that is missing from the debate between the pro-choicers and the pro-lifers is this: When a woman decides to kill her unborn child she is not only killing the flesh and the love that the child would have had for her but she is also sending the soul of that baby back to God and the Angels in Heaven. Imagine how the creator of the universe feels about that. When a woman kills her unborn child and that child gets back to Heaven, what does that child talk to Jesus about. I reckon that baby would be very sad about being killed by her own mother. How could it be otherwise? I wonder what Jesus tells that murdered baby to comfort her and make her feel better? Does the baby who was killed by her own mother hate her mother, or just feel sorry for her? I wonder. I think that the murdered baby would say, " Momma, why did you kill me, I only wanted to hold you and love you."
 A woman's legal right to chose between life and death for her child is the most important decision that she may ever make. If she chooses to abort that baby, she may be killing only one soul, her own. Abortion is wrong, chose life.

Hunter, I don't mean to be ridiculing when I say this but....do you really think that Jesus and an aborted fetus have a conversation about what happened? You are trivializing heaven into a child's way of thinking. There is no conversation of such taking place in the afterlife......you are just trying to evoke some sympathetic feelings from someone and you know there are no sympathetic people here who are going to buy into that scenario.....right? 
 
 Whether a woman chooses to have an abortion is a personal choice, just as believing or not believing in God is a choice. I do know of a few people who had abortions who had serious depression to the point of mental illness afterward, and others who were never able to conceive again.
 
 I too wonder why God allows babies and children to suffer but it is beyond us to know or understand why this happens. It may be because of a choice someone made that causes the afflictions we see in people. We have free will, why should it not include abortion? All the things we choose may not be the best choice, but we have to live with it.
